text: Dark Souls 2 scholar of the first sin
came out yesterday but there's a bunch
of different options you can go for in
terms of the game's pricing the first
option is for people who haven't got
Dark Souls 2 you can get the full game
with either directx9 for
$339.99 or you can get it with directx11
for
$449.99 which version you choose will
likely depend on the quality of the PC
that you own but the important thing is
that you remain in denial about the
existence of bloodborne next up for
those of you who already own Dark Souls
2 on PC you can upgrade to the new
version for $29.99 and this is a choice
you want to go for if you're somebody
who refuses to admit that bloodborne is
a game that exists and that you can buy
and lastly if you've already got Dark
Souls 2 and all of the DLC on PC then
you can upgrade to the latest version
for
$1999 now this choice is perfect for
people who don't own a PlayStation 4 and
just blindly refuse to accept that
bloodborne is something that out there
and that exists and that you could and
should be playing in instead if you're
the sort of gamer who blindly refuses to
buy anything which isn't released on PC
then this is probably a really valuable
use of your money thanks very much for
watching bye
